instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no power"
threads.message:
USB C amp meter stays on 5v and pulls .01A
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is .9V  

Man I must be a moron because I am lost on this thing.  I can't find any shorts, no thermal.
I can't track down the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> source.   Not sure with this LB

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no power"
threads.message: Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, A/BMON, <SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no power"
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> is the 5v
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> is 0 "5v on the other side of <RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR>
VDDIO1P8 0v
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> 0v
BMON 0v
<SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL> 0v

I did replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> "from donor board" but who knows if it was any good.
same fault condition.


Noticed only 100 ohm resistance on F700,7001
Injected 3v3 and found <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> glowed on thermal pulling 0.07A

Welcome to the rabbit hole.
<CHIP>U7650</CHIP> was causing the 100 ohm short.
Replaced.  Got 19v and then it died again.   Found UA951 had shorted.   removed and injecting power at output.
traced the UA951 short to UA600

Jumped ahead and the GPU is totally shorted.   :(   

WTF happened to this LB?
